alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 10 at 8:17PM MST until August 10 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 816 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Kearny to 13 miles south of Boyce Thompson Arboretum to 9 miles east of Florence to Coolidge Airport to Picacho, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 184 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 167 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 209 and 228. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Superior, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Arizola and Boyce Thompson Arboretum. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
